ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Maureen is great, 1337.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Good balance of nuts and bolts lectures with guest speakers.
Getting to work directly with a client.
Working with a real world client.
Getting a solid client that does interesting things and can open up job opportunities.
Hands-on experience with a consulting project. It allows students to practice using their skills in the "real world" but with the support of Maureen.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Maybe have 4 out of 6 guest lectures mandatory? Could have put some of that time towards group work or client calls.

The client was bubbling with ideas (a good thing) but it took half the semester just to decide on what we should actually be working on, and then only once we submitted our final report for his review did he truly elucidate what questions he wanted answered. In other words, the 'client' should have a clear goal from the start.

Some groups, not mine, probably got screwed with lame or "tease" clients that will not do a damn thing to help them get a job. Clients who have a skewed view of "quid pro quo" would probably be awful, I was fortunate not to have that situation.
Nothing

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes.
Maureen supplements the class lectures with additional office hours with groups which is very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Great way to apply knowledge to real-world problems. Just what I needed to complement my academic activities this semester!
A great way to close out my FES studies because I apply my specialty knowledge to the real life problems of my client.
This course is great for people who want to practice the skills they have learned in other classes and for people who want to turn a project in that means more than a grade.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Based on the client that had signed up.
To work with a client and get real-world experience.
Looks great on resume, and its my capstone project.
I wanted to practice using the skills I'd learned in other classes and was excited to work on a project that would help a business (rather than just get graded by a professor).

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes.
Yes, except that reading ease stuff is horse shit. She should stop pushing that so hard. It's a goofy simplistic metric.
Absolutely.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: All good things. Most functional group I've had at Yale so far.
An advantage was that we were able to focus on individual sections instead of each working on all parts. A challenge was consistently effective communication.
Delegation of duties.

Working in a group allowed me to get constant feedback and support on my work. I was lucky to have a group where all members pulled their own weight and we got along very well. I think this allowed us to create a great report for our client.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do it!
Hound your client for a clear assignment from the beginning. Talk to them every day if you need to.
Take it if you can get a good client.
Take it!
